qas.question: Most countries besides the US use what ISO System?
What country first adopted the ISO 216 standard?
What is the largest standard size paper?
How many sheets of A1 paper would cover one single piece of A0 paper?
What is the lowest numbered A paper that is commonly used at home?
Instead of the surface area of paper, what is the ISO 216 system based on?
When was the ISO 1189 system first adopted in Germany?
What is the smallest standard paper size?
How many sheets of A1 fit into a sheet of A2?
What are some common sizes never used in the home or office?
Most countries besides the UK use what ISO System?
What country first rejected the ISO 216 standard?
What is the smallest standard size paper?
How many sheets of A1 paper would cover one single piece of AD paper?
What is the lowest numbered A paper that is uncommonly used at home?

context: The <a0_0><b10_0>ISO <a3_0>2<a3_0/>16<b10_0/><a0_0/> system used in most other countries is based on the surface area of a sheet of paper, not on a sheet's <b5_0>width and length<b5_0/>. It was first adopted in <a1_0><b11_0>Germany<b11_0/><a1_0/> in <b6_0>1922<b6_0/> and generally spread as nations adopted the metric system. The largest standard size paper is <a2_0><b7_0><b12_0>A0<b12_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/> (A zero), measuring one square meter (approx. 1189 × 841 mm). Two sheets of A1, placed upright side by side fit exactly into one sheet of A0 laid on its side. Similarly, <b8_0>two<b8_0/> sheets of <b13_0>A2<b13_0/> fit into one sheet of A1 and so forth. Common sizes used in the office and the home are <b9_0>A4 and <a4_0>A3<b9_0/><a4_0/> (<b14_0>A3<b14_0/> is the size of two A4 sheets).
